summary.para: Monitors the occlusion state of a camera device.

remarks.para: Many devices provide mechanisms, such as a mechanical shutter, that allow the user to occlude the camera device for privacy. Other devices may occlude the camera in certain postures. This interface allows applications to receive notifications when the occlusion state of the camera changes so they can disable or modify their camera capture behavior when the camera is occluded. Note that some devices may have a mechanical camera shutter without a mechanism for sensing or reporting the state of the shutter, and therefore the camera occlusion APIs are unable to provide occlusion information on these devices. Also, some devices may not have a dedicated camera shutter but will still update the occlusion status of the camera based on whether the device lid is open or closed.
